greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is number of Grand Motzkin paths of length n having k returns to the x-axis (i.e., d or u steps hitting the x-axis).
comment: A Grand Motzkin path is a path in the half-plane x>=0, starting at (0,0), ending at (n,0) and consisting of steps u=(1,1), d=(1,-1) and h=(1,0).
Row sums yield the central trinomial coefficients (A002426).
formula: G.f.: 1/(1 - z - 2tz^2*M), where M = 1 + zM + z^2*M^2 = (1 - z - sqrt(1 - 2z - 3z^2))/(2z^2) is the g.f. of the Motzkin numbers (A001006).
example: T(4,2)=4 because we have udud, dudu, uddu and duud, where u=(1,1), d=(1,-1), h=(1,0).
maple: M:=(1-z-sqrt(1-2*z-3*z^2))/2/z^2: G:=1/(1-z-2*t*z^2*M): Gser:=simplify(series(G,z=0,17)): P[0]:=1: for n from 1 to 14 do P[n]:=coeff(Gser,z^n) od: for n from 0 to 14 do seq(coeff(t*P[n],t^k),k=1..1+floor(n/2)) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Jun 22 2005
